result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan L Heisz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jordan L Heisz in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed. Reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, defendant placed on 2 1/2 years probation on each count, conds: $518, $278 costs. Submit DNA sample. Comply with all treatment recommendations of agent. Submit DNA sample. Court found good cause for expungement of case, after 2 1/2 years, and upon successful completion of probation and no other convictions. No jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Jordan L Heisz in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed previously, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Defendant may leave the state to travel to Missouri from 12/24/15 to 12/27/15.
